page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY GOLDSBORO'AREA
page.content: { Goldsborough Hall}is a{Jacobean} brick rectangular,mansion,3 storeys high with fine{stone mullioned}windows.The exterior has been little altered,but the interior has seen changes,many of these being made by the{Adam brothers} engaged in 1770 by{Daniel Lascelles. There are some original plastered ceilings,panelling and a fine stone fireplace in the dining-room. In the{recent}past it has been the home of{royalty,a boys boarding school and is now used as a{nursing home}with facilities for approx.36 residents and 50 staff.At present an extension is being made in keeping with the Hall to accommodate a further 15 residents. The{stables and outbuildings}in the courtyard have been converted into sheltered housing for people over the age of 55.
